textContent:
Aaron was with Gil at a big event. At the conclusion of the event Aaron wanted to throw a big party. All of his friends were there and encouraging him. 

But he lost site of Gil and Nick and tried calling them. 

Aaron kept seeing women in his life that were encouraging him to throw the party. They were also flirty making Aaron uncomfortable

Then Aaron called gil and got no answer. Then aaron called Nick and got a cheerful answer saying he was home and wanted to be home. We got disconnected so I called gil back. she was with Nick but sounded annoyed and disappointed. I asked where she was and she said home and that she didn't want to go out. 

I felt like there was a judgement and an anger towards me that I wasn't there with her and that I was chosing everyone else, including other women, over her. 

So I contemplated giving up on the party and coming back or staying. Both felt like they had big risks with them. Both killing important parts of me. 

Then it hit me. What the women around me represented was engagement in my shared interests and a desire to hang out together, more short term joy.  What gil represented was a separate self that was better and more full of long term joy. And what I had the resolve to do was to confidently throw the party while remaining completely committed to Gil and what I wanted gil to do was to encourage me and appreciate my differences, not acting like they were zero sum. 

Then I woke up
title: Dream about Gil
textContentHtml:
Aaron was with Gil at a big event. At the conclusion of the event Aaron wanted to throw a big party. All of his friends were there and encouraging him. 


But he lost site of Gil and Nick and tried calling them. 


Aaron kept seeing women in his life that were encouraging him to throw the party. They were also flirty making Aaron uncomfortable


Then Aaron called gil and got no answer. Then aaron called Nick and got a cheerful answer saying he was home and wanted to be home. We got disconnected so I called gil back. she was with Nick but sounded annoyed and disappointed. I asked where she was and she said home and that she didn't want to go out. 


I felt like there was a judgement and an anger towards me that I wasn't there with her and that I was chosing everyone else, including other women, over her. 


So I contemplated giving up on the party and coming back or staying. Both felt like they had big risks with them. Both killing important parts of me. 


Then it hit me. What the women around me represented was engagement in my shared interests and a desire to hang out together, more short term joy.  What gil represented was a separate self that was better and more full of long term joy. And what I had the resolve to do was to confidently throw the party while remaining completely committed to Gil and what I wanted gil to do was to encourage me and appreciate my differences, not acting like they were zero sum. 


Then I woke up
